definitions: To change the corporate image of (a company or organization) by changing its name, logo, or other identifying features.
To change the public perception or marketing of a product, service, or company.
examples: The company decided to rebrand its entire product line.
They hired a new agency to rebrand their image.
The goal was to rebrand the old hotel into a modern boutique.
It's time to rebrand and attract a younger audience.
